page.title: 01MISSON
page.content: Misson is a small village in rural Nottinghamshire. It has a population of 633 many of which are retired and quite a lot being in the farming industry. The River Idle flows through Misson. At one end of the village there is a quarry from which sand is quarried. The village has a church, chapel, a school, two shops,(one of which is a post office) two pubs and a community centre.A mobile library and fruit and vegetable van visit the village once weekly.In the middle of the village there is a small green.Misson also has a football pitch which also is used as a cricket pitch.As the main industry in Misson is farming we have a factory which dries various crops and stores them.
